snippet: The Niners restructured their already team-friendly contract with their quarterback ahead of his start on Sunday, eliminating their financial exposure in case of an injury....
abstract: Joe Nocera Sports Business column examines San Francisco 49ers demand that quarterback Colin Kaepernick waive injury guarantee worth $14 million before returning him to starting role; notes contrast between NFL's approach to injury guarantees and those offered in other professional sports.
lead_paragraph: The Niners restructured their already team-friendly contract with their quarterback ahead of his start on Sunday, eliminating their financial exposure in case of an injury.

headline.print_headline: Taking $14 Million, and All of the Risk
headline.main: Is It a Risk for the 49ers to Start Colin Kaepernick? Not for Them.
